Articles.Content:
http://www.thisiswhyimbroke.com/

Are these guys for real? I don't trust internet sellers, but the stuff sold here seems plausible enough not to be fake, well, at least a couple of them.
The "check it out" links lead to the actual, legit places that are selling the products.

"Ever wonder what Uranus tastes like?"

That's one hell of a selling point. Chocolate planets are cool, but.....

- - - Updated - - -

Just noticed the 'Diesel Powered MechWarrior' for 1.35 million dollars.

A quick browse shows nothing that smells funny.

Also, that's the worst scale model of the Solar system. Not because the sizes are off, but because I'd eat it and have none left.

A bit pricey.

Some items on that site are borderline scams. Others are just insane either in design or price. Or both. But the majority is real. I've seen several of them on TV and a few I've seen with my own eyes. Pretty sure that site is legit.

"Color Blindness Correcting Glasses"

I'm skeptical about it's functionality.

A bunch of BS that will sit around after a month. The only thing that I have on that site is the "Calculator Watch", and if you're math-deficient like me it can be a big help at the store or wherever.

A bunch of BS that will sit around after a month. The only thing that I have on that site is the "Calculator Watch", and if you're math-deficient like me it can be a big help at the store or wherever.

Though a smart phone, even an oldie, is much more proficient at crunching numbers and even doing very fancy complicated stuff.

Though a smart phone, even an oldie, is much more proficient at crunching numbers and even doing very fancy complicated stuff.

I don't have a smart phone. I don't even have a cell phone. When I get a cell phone, it will be a flip phone; smart phones are too confusing for me. Watching me try to figure out a smart phone is like watching a monkey trying to figure out a nuclear power plant.

A bunch of BS that will sit around after a month. The only thing that I have on that site is the "Calculator Watch", and if you're math-deficient like me it can be a big help at the store or wherever.

I would use a secret door kit.

Some of the stuff is blown up to sound greater than it actually is, but I would say most of the stuff on there is real. It may not be as functional as advertised but I bet it would at least function poorly.

What I'm not sure about is the ability to purchase everything on that site.
The nutella lock and life-sized AT-ST both seem very useful. The space shuttle replica is great, how have I lived without it? The Amphibious Recreational Vehicle is also a must have.
I'm never going to buy anything from that site, but it's a great place for inspiration.
